suppress.notes: ldap and groovy related and they are not used in production
CVE-2016-7048: only for Postgres lt 9.6 and we use 9.6 on Azure. Also only impacts the installer.
h2database is not used in production
h2database is pulled in by liquibase, it is not used in development or production
We do not use: Spring Framework 5.0.5.RELEASE + Spring Security (any version), see https://pivotal.io/security/cve-2018-1258
Temporary suppression while we investigate. See RDM-3324
Temporary suppression to ignore CVE with com.google.guava. See RDM-3372

Temporary suppression of an issue related to the current stable slf4j which is brought in by other dependencies. CCD don't explicitly declare dependencies on slf4j. org.slf4j.ext.EventData in the slf4j-ext module in QOS.CH SLF4J before 1.8.0-beta2 allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions via crafted data. Investigation notes can be found in RDM-3549. slf4j may need to be updated when a future stable version is released
Suppressing as it seems a false positive as per https://github.com/jeremylong/DependencyCheck/issues/1573
Temp suppression to unblock FE pipeline. cpe:2.3:a:security-framework_project:security-framework:5.1.5 | RDM-7406
